intro: Fusanus compressus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fusanus, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves that are typically arranged in a pinnate pattern. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Fusanus compressus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
